title: The International Studio Unitwin Summer Design Camp
author: lptan
content:
The Vietnam studio topic was "Market life - Story of Sai Gon" with the participation of instructors and students from: University of Economics Ho Chi Minh city (UEH), Ho Chi Minh City University of Technology (HUT), University of Architecture Ho Chi Minh city (AUH) and Ton Duc Thang University (TDTU). ISCM â€“ UEH plays host this activity from 27 to 31 July 2020. During the studio, many lectures were presented by professors and experts. title: A memorandum of cooperation (MoU) at the studio-lab of ISCM
author: ISCM
content: On June 26, 2020, the Institute of Smart Cities and Management (ISCM) and IOTLink Co., Ltd. held a ceremony to sign a memorandum of cooperation (MoU) at the studio-lab of ISCM, marking a milestone in tightening the relationship between the two parties. Through this agreement, ISCM and IOTLink agreed on follow-up joint activities, including providing resources and cooperating in researching and developing projects of the two sides. The ceremony was attended by Mr. Do Quang Vinh - CEO of IOTLINK Co., Ltd. and Dr. Trinh Tu Anh - Director of the Institute of Smart Cities and Management (ISCM), University of Economics Ho Chi Minh city.

title: " The Operation House station of Ho Chi Minh City Urban Railway
author: lptan
content:
In the morning of July 24, 2020, ISCM-University of Economics Ho Chi Minh City held a visit for lecturers from University of Economics Ho Chi Minh City, University of Architecture Ho Chi Minh City, Ho Chi Minh City University of Technology, and Ton Duc Thang University to the Operation House station of Ho Chi Minh City Urban Railway Construction Project, Ben Thanh - Suoi Tien Section (Line 1). The Metro project (Line 1) consists of 14 stations (3 underground stations and 11 elevated stations) and 19.7 km length with 2.6km underground- and 17.1km elevated section. The project includes four main packages, as follows:


- The package 1a (Underground metro construction from Ben Thanh station to Opera House)
- The package 1b (Underground metro construction from the Opera House to Ba Son)
- The package 2 (Construction of elevated railway and depots)
- The package 3 (Purchase and installation of electrical systems, rolling stock, rail and maintenance)

title: Smart design thinking to lead post - pandemic urban design
author: lptan
content:
In the "Shaping the unknown future toward smart city" events, the 2020 international online summer design camp kick off meeting with the theme "Smart design thinking to lead post - pandemic urban design" will be held at 2p.m Monday, 20 July 2020 at ISCM studio-lab. In Viet Nam, the workshop will host students and instructors from universities: University of Economics Ho Chi Minh city (UEH), Ho Chi Minh City University of Technology (HCMUT), University of Architecture Ho Chi Minh city (UAHCM), Ton Duc Thang university... with the topic "Market life - Story of Sai Gon"

Live streaming of kick off meetings is available to the public by visiting fanpage UEH - Institute of Smart City and Management Link fanpage: https://www.facebook.com/ISCM.ueh

title: Urban Economic Development in Ho Chi Minh City â€“ Current Issues and Solutions
author: lptan
content:
UEH organized a workshop on â€œUrban Economic Development in Ho Chi Minh City â€“ Current Issues and Solutionsâ€ for the project led by Central Economic Commission
On the morning of July 15 2020, at Room. A101 (59C Nguyen Dinh Chieu Street, Ward 6, District 3, Ho Chi Minh City), UEH solemnly held the workshop â€œUrban Economic Development in Ho Chi Minh City: Current Issues and Solutionsâ€. The workshop is to build the project â€œUrbanization and Urban Development in Vietnam through 2030, a vision towards 2045â€, led by Central Economic Commission and relevant units.
On the behalf of the research team, Dr. TÃº Anh Trinh â€“ Director of Institute of Smart City and Management, had a presentation on current issues of urbanization, urban economic development in the period 2011-2020, lessons learned from other countries such as New York, Singapore, Paris, Amsterdam, and SWOT analysis of urbanization process in Vietnam. Proposed solutions by the research team are integrated solutions to enhance sustainable urbanization and urban development through 2030, a vision towards 2045.
During the workshop, delegates shared and discussed their ideas on current issues and solutions for urban economic development in Ho Chi Minh City. Hopefully, with efforts of the research team and valuable contributions of the workshop delegates, the project â€œUrbanization and uran economic development in Vietnam through 2030, a vision towards 2045â€ organized by Central Economic Commission is successfully completed.

title: From Smart to Sustainable
author: lptan
content: The University of Economics Ho Chi Minh City (UEH) formally launched Financial Technology Institute (FTI), Institute of Smart City and Management (ISCM), and Health and Agricultural Policy Research Institute (HAPRI) on June 16, 2020. With the theme â€œFrom Smart to Sustainableâ€, the launch event marked the official opening of the three institutes with the important roles in connecting the community, creating a learning, research, and training environment, professional consulting on financial technology, and evaluating the impact of technology in all aspects of social life, and addressing urban development issues, food security towards building a smart city and a green, sustainable agriculture for health.
